greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) = number of compositions of n into k parts such that no two adjacent parts are equal.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..141, flattened
A. Knopfmacher and H. Prodinger, On Carlitz compositions, European Journal of Combinatorics, Vol. 19, 1998, pp. 579-589.
example: T(6,3) = 7 because the compositions of 6 into 3 parts with no adjacent equal parts are 3+2+1, 3+1+2, 2+3+1, 2+1+3, 1+3+2, 1+2+3, 1+4+1.
maple: b:= proc(n, h, t) option remember;
else add(`if`(h=j, 0, b(n-j, j, t-1)), j=1..n)
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=1..n), n=1..15); # _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 23 2011
program: for(n=1, 10, my(p=polcoeff(gf(n,y),n)); for(k=1, n, print1(polcoeff(p,k), ", ")); print); \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Oct 12 2017
xref: Cf. A131044 (at least two adjacent parts are equal).
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, Apr 29 2005
